name: libfuse

conflicts.name: platform=darwin
conflicts.description: libfuse does not support OS-X, use macfuse instead

variants.name: default_library
variants.description: Build shared libs, static libs or both

variants.name: useroot
variants.description: Use root privileges to make fusermount a setuid binary after installation

variants.name: system_install
variants.description: Do not run the post-install script which typically sets up udev rules and and init script in /etc/init.d

description:
The reference implementation of the Linux FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace)
interface

dependencies.name: meson
dependencies.description:
Meson is a portable open source build system meant to be both extremely
fast, and as user friendly as possible.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependent_to.name: fuse-overlayfs
dependent_to.description: An implementation of overlay+shiftfs in FUSE for rootless containers.

dependent_to.name: squashfuse
dependent_to.description: squashfuse - Mount SquashFS archives using FUSE

dependent_to.name: py-fusepy
dependent_to.description:
Fusepy is a Python module that provides a simple interface to FUSE and
MacFUSE. It's just one file and is implemented using ctypes.

dependent_to.name: sshfs
dependent_to.description: SSHFS allows you to mount a remote filesystem using SFTP.
